OVERVIEW: The Moslander series consists of very deep, poorly drained soils that formed in alluvium from mixed sources.  These soils are on stream terraces, valley fill, and marshes.  Slopes are 0 to 3 percent and slightly concave.  The mean annual precipitation is about 17 inches, and the mean annual air temperature is about 38 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, mixed, superactive, calcareous Typic Cryaquolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Moslander loam-wet meadow.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated.)
Oi--1 inch to 0; dense, fibrous mat of roots.
A--0 to 8 inches; dark gray (10YR 4/1) loam, very dark gray (10YR 3/1) moist; moderate medium granular structure; soft, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; slightly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; slightly alkaline (pH 7.4); clear wavy boundary.  (6 to 10 inches thick)
Bg--8 to 16 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, very dark gray (10YR 3/1) moist; common fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; moderate medium and coarse subangular blocky structure parting to moderate medium granular; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common fine and medium roots; slightly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (5 to 10 inches thick)
BCg--16 to 26 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, dark gray (10YR 4/1) moist; common fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; very weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common medium roots; strongly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual wavy boundary. (0 to 12 inches thick).
C1g--26 to 32 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, dark gray (10YR 4/1) moist; common fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; massive; very hard, firm, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; strongly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (6 to 25 inches thick)
C2g--32 to 60 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, dark gray (10YR 4/1) moist; many medium prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; massive; very hard, firm, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; strongly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Natrona County, Wyoming; approximately 1,850 feet east and 1,450 feet south of the northwest corner of sec. 23, T. 39 N., R. 87 W.  It is about 220 feet southeast of an old abandoned trapper's cabin 80 feet south of the trail. Badwater SE Quad, 43 degrees 20 minutes 23 seconds north latitude and 107 degrees 15 minutes 11 seconds west longitude.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The mollic epipedon ranges from 7 to 19 inches thick.  These soils are typically calcareous throughout when dried but are free of carbonates as deep as  10 inches in some pedons.  The mean annual soil temperature ranges from 39 to 43 degrees F., and the mean summer soil temperature ranges from 50 to 54 degrees F.  The particle-size control section when averaged is loam or clay loam with 18 to 35 percent clay, 20 to 55 percent silt, and 20 to 55 percent sand with less than 35 percent but more than 15 percent being fine sand or coarser.  Thin strata of varying textures are common in some pedons but when averaged meet the criteria stated above.  Rock fragments range from 0 to 15 percent rounded gravel above a depth of 40 inches.  Exchangeable sodium ranges from 0 to 15 percent.
The A horizon has hue of 5Y through 10YR, value of 3 through 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of N through 2.  EC ranges from 0 to 4 mmhos. It is mildly alkaline or moderately alkaline.
The Bg horizon has hue of 5Y through 10YR, value of 3 through 5 dry, 2 through 4 moist, and chroma of N through 2.  EC ranges from 0 to 4 mmhos.  High chroma redox concentrations are common in this horizon.  It is mildly alkaline through strongly alkaline.
The Cg horizon has hue of 5Y through 10YR, value of 4 through 7 dry, 4 through 6 moist, and chroma of N through 2.  EC ranges from 2 to 8 mmhos.  Salt accumulations  are present in some pedons.  High chroma redox concentrations are common.  It is moderately alkaline or strongly alkaline.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  This is the Tonks series which has a horizon of secondary carbonate accumulations above 40 inches.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Moslander soils are on stream terraces, valley fill, and marshes in high mountain areas.  These soils formed in alluvium from mixed sources.  Slopes are 0 to 3 percent. Elevations are 6,600 to 8,600 feet.  The mean annual precipitation ranges from 14 to 19 inches, and the mean annual air temperature ranges from 36 to 42 degrees F.  The frost-free season is estimated to range from 50 to 80 days, but light frost may occur during any month. This soil has a water table within 20 inches of the surface during most of the year.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Clayburn and Heinsaw soils.  Clayburn soils have an argillic horizon and are not saturated with water.  Heinsaw soils have less than 18 percent clay in the control section.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Poorly drained; slow or medium runoff; moderate or moderately slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Rangeland, hay meadow, and wildlife habitat. Native vegetation consists of sedges, northern reedgrass, tufted hairgrass, willow, and baltic rush.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  High mountain valleys in central and southwestern Wyoming.  The series is of small extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are:
Oi horizon - 1 to 0 inches
Mollic epipedon - 0 to 16 inches (A,Bg)
MLRR - D
SIR - WY0357
The superactive cation exchange activity class was added in 03/2003 to the taxonomic classification by the National Soil Survey Center on request of the Lakewood MLRA office, without review of the soil series property data. The remainder of this document has not been updated.

HORIZONS.name: A
HORIZONS.narrative: A--0 to 8 inches; dark gray (10YR 4/1) loam, very dark gray (10YR 3/1) moist; moderate medium granular structure; soft, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; slightly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; slightly alkaline (pH 7.4); clear wavy boundary.  (6 to 10 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: Bg
HORIZONS.structure: moderate medium and coarse subangular blocky
HORIZONS.narrative: Bg--8 to 16 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, very dark gray (10YR 3/1) moist; common fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; moderate medium and coarse subangular blocky structure parting to moderate medium granular; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common fine and medium roots; slightly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (5 to 10 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: BCg
HORIZONS.narrative: BCg--16 to 26 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, dark gray (10YR 4/1) moist; common fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; very weak fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common medium roots; strongly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual wavy boundary. (0 to 12 inches thick).

HORIZONS.name: C1g
HORIZONS.narrative: C1g--26 to 32 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, dark gray (10YR 4/1) moist; common fine prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; massive; very hard, firm, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; strongly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (6 to 25 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: C2g
HORIZONS.narrative: C2g--32 to 60 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) clay loam, dark gray (10YR 4/1) moist; many medium prominent yellowish red (5YR 5/6) moist redox concentrations; massive; very hard, firm, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; strongly effervescent when dry, calcium carbonate disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.0).

HORIZONS.name: Oi
HORIZONS.narrative: Oi--1 inch to 0; dense, fibrous mat of roots.
